Key Match Events: Australia beat Afghanistan by 4 wickets on Friday
Rashid Khan scored an unbeaten 23-ball 48, but his knock went in vain
Glenn Maxwell scored 54 off 32 with six fours and two sixes
Mitchell Marsh scored 45 off 30 while batting at No.3
David Warner and Marcus Stoinis made 25 runs each
Pre-Game Insights: Australia had to score a minimum of 185 to topple New Zealand on net run rate
Australia needed to restrict Afghanistan to 105 or below to surpass England’s net run rate
Post-Match Reflections: Australia finish with 7 points in their Super 12 Group
Sri Lanka have to beat England on Saturday for Australia to qualify for the semis
If the match on November 5 gets washed off, Australia will go through with seven points
Miscellaneous Highlights: Matthew Wade led Australia in the absence of Aaron Finch
Glenn Maxwell pulled off a superb direct hit to send Gulbadin Naib back to the hut
